intro: Daemonorops horrida, commonly known as the hairy pandanus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arales. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, pinnate leaves that are often covered in coarse, fibrous hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in branched inflorescences. Its fibrous leaves are used in traditional crafts and as thatching material in some regions. The plant thrives in coastal and wetland areas, where it plays an important ecological role.
